Articles.Content: On another note, I need to recommend something to NathanKell. Can there be an overlay that shows each planet's equator, moon inclination(s) and satellite orbit inclinations in a way that the difference between them and your ship's orbital inclination will be visible in-flight? Perhaps that is achievable by showing the equator/orbits on Earth itself? That is irrelevant in stock KSP, but, in RSS, a degree of inclination difference can mean everything.

59 minutes ago, 073198681 said:

On another note, I need to recommend something to NathanKell. Can there be an overlay that shows each planet's equator, moon inclination(s) and satellite orbit inclinations in a way that the difference between them and your ship's orbital inclination will be visible in-flight? Perhaps that is achievable by showing the equator/orbits on Earth itself? That is irrelevant in stock KSP, but, in RSS, a degree of inclination difference can mean everything.

MechJeb or engineer redux will show you your equatorial inclination and time to an/dn in a HUD display. If you want a visual indicator, launch a beacon to geosync, or hyperedit one up.

For the moons, if you set them as a target you should get the same information.

 

Edited December 20, 2015 by Unit327

On 12/22/2015 at 4:44 PM, Jimbodiah said:

Do EVE and Scatterer work in combination with RSS at the moment?

EVE does not, the dev version of RVE does, kind of. I have not yet been able to clouds and scatterer working reliably without bugs. When I carefully followed the RVE instructions I encountered the Earth->Kerbin problem and contracts and science got all screwed up.

Is there an configuration of EVE, RVE and/or scatterer that works for RSS, RO and RP-0?

On 12/22/2015 at 2:44 AM, Jimbodiah said:

Do EVE and Scatterer work in combination with RSS at the moment?

EVE certainly works but for Scatterer there were some issues with the scaling (scatter "sphere" not scaling with the planet radius). Best of all, even works with RP-0!

@ZaPPPathe problem with RVE and RP-0 is that RVE was built with the EVE version 7.4 and has not been updated for 1.0.5. The Earth/Kerbin name is not a problem anymore.

Remove image links

15 minutes ago, Phineas Freak said:

EVE certainly works but for Scatterer there were some issues with the scaling (scatter "sphere" not scaling with the planet radius). Best of all, even works with RP-0!

Sample screenshots:

  Reveal hidden contents

@ZaPPPathe problem with RVE and RP-0 is that RVE was built with the EVE version 7.4 and has not been updated for 1.0.5. The Earth/Kerbin name is not a problem anymore.

Can you walk me through the install process for EVE and RSS? I installed the latest version and KSP runs, but no clouds show up on Earth.

Currently, RVE will not work "as - is". You will need to create your own configs for pretty much everything. If you don't have a problem with that, here are the steps that i used in order to make it work:

1. Get the latest version of EVE (1.05.4) binaries.
2. Download the RVE package from Pingopete's GitHub repository. I am using the Linux branch but i would recommend to use the Windows one.
3. Install the EVE binaries and the RVE folder to the GameData folder.
4. Remove the previous clouds, city lights and terrain EVE configs from RVE and create new template configs (EVE expects them and will not initialize the interface correctly without them):

CityLights.cfg 

EVE_CITY_LIGHTS
{
}

Clouds.cfg 

EVE_CLOUDS
{
}

Terrain.cfg 

EVE_TERRAIN
{
}

5. Start KSP, go to the Tracking Station and open the EVE interface (Alt + 0).

From now on, you are free to create clouds!

Edited December 27, 2015 by Phineas Freak

I'm getting a bug where the Visual Planet is not on the location where the game really places the planet. Hard to explain, here is a screenshot:

As I scroll out, the visual planet 'moves' further away from its location.

Same for the sun:

 

And all other planets:

 

Bug happens quite often, every couple of times I open the tracking station. And is hard to ignore, because its very difficult to see launch site locations, orbits, etc. Full restart of the program fixes the issue.

I am using Realism Overhaul, Real Solar System, RP-0, and Remote Tech as addons.

ÈDIT: Restarting the game seems to no longer fix the bug ...

EDIT: seems like I messed up my screenshots, the 'double UI' in the last 3 images is just on the screenshots, thats not a bug ingame.

Edited December 27, 2015 by CitizenVeen

Got another bug. After switching to another Launch Site. The Research Building and the Tracking station has disappeared... Can't switch back to Cape Carnaval because.. no tracking station ...

I think its because the landscape is hilllike, and these buildings have disappeared beneath the surface. Not sure if I'm correct though.

Edited December 27, 2015 by CitizenVeen

5 hours ago, Phineas Freak said:

Currently, RVE will not work "as - is". You will need to create your own configs for pretty much everything. If you don't have a problem with that, here are the steps that i used in order to make it work:

1. Get the latest version of EVE (1.05.4) binaries.
2. Download the RVE package from Pingopete's GitHub repository. I am using the Linux branch but i would recommend to use the Windows one.
3. Install the EVE binaries and the RVE folder to the GameData folder.
4. Remove the previous clouds, city lights and terrain EVE configs from RVE and create new template configs (EVE expects them and will not initialize the interface correctly without them):

<snip>

5. Start KSP, go to the Tracking Station and open the EVE interface (Alt + 0).

From now on, you are free to create clouds!

Still does not seem to work for me.

First off I think the line 

'!cbNameLater = DEL '

in the RVE.cfg file seems to be conflicting with a number of other mods. If I comment this out, KSP starts throwing exceptions 'InvalidOperationException'

Also, I am on Linux64 and I am unable to bring up the EVE interface, no matter what button combination I try.

Forgot to mention that it is best to remove for now the RVE.cfg or use the following one: 

@Kopernicus:FOR[RVE]:NEEDS[RealSolarSystem]
{
    @Body[Sun]
    {
        @ScaledVersion
        {
            %SolarLightColor
            {
                %sunLensFlareColor = 33, 33, 33, 1
                %sunAU = 1

                !sunBrigthnessCurve {}

                sunBrigthnessCurve
                {
                    key = 0           300000 0 0
                    key = 1530000000  150000 0 0
                    key = 80000000000 100000 0 0
                }
            }
        }
    }

    @Body[Kerbin]
    {
        @Atmosphere
        {
            @AtmosphereFromGround
            {
                %waveLength = 0.65, 0.6, 0.53, 1.0
                %ESun = 0
                %Kr = 0.0007
                %Km = 0.0006
            }
        }
    }
}

Anyone who is willing to fix even a single site, that would be awesome. You edit the launch sites cfg using these docs: https://github.com/NathanKell/RealSolarSystem/wiki/PQSCity-and-PQSMod_MapDecalTangent

hey there. I was looking forward to trying out your mod but it will not load, Ksp Hangs just after the part bar finishes and sits there saying loading with the planets moving around. i do get the MM loading 375 patches at this time. i have not other mod installed just what came with your D/L i.e RealSolarSystem, Kopernicus, MM  as well RSS-Textures pack  4096 and 2048 tried them both. i am running a Mac with 26 GB of ram.. i was not sure where to put the  texture pack so i just put it in to the Gamedata\RealSolarSystem\RSS-Textures.

 

i have also tried running the game with and without the Texture pack  one thing i did do and it loaded was i removed the Kopernicus folder the game did load but of course  RSS did not work. Maybe there some thing i did not do with it, or it don't like me.

 

Thanks 

Molly

One question:

Where exactly do you put the resolution pack? I am using the 2048 pack, but I don't know where to put it in the RSS folder.

 

Oh yeah, and for some reason it isn't working. I have the most recent update. I just think it is the res. pack. Is there something I'm doing wrong? 

Edited December 30, 2015 by nickrulercreator
forgot a part
The textures pack shouldn't go in the RSS folder -- there should be (separate) RSS and RSS-Textures folders in GameData.

Forgot to mention that it is best to remove for now the RVE.cfg or use the following one:
